FuncDef:
The mld snooping ssm-mapping command configures the mapping between an any-source multicast group address in the source-specific multicast (SSM) range and a multicast source address.
The undo mld snooping ssm-mapping command deletes a configured mapping. The mld snooping ssm-mapping command configures the mapping between an any-source multicast group address in the source-specific multicast (SSM) range and a multicast source address. The undo mld snooping ssm-mapping command deletes a configured mapping. By default, no mapping is configured between an any-source multicast group address in the SSM range and a multicast source address. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv6 multicast group address in the SSM range.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X. And the value must be within the group address range defined in the SSM policy.

Specifies the mask length of an IPv6 multicast group address.
The value is an integer ranging from 8 to 128.

Specifies an IPv6 multicast source address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.
